title: Not able to tag experiment to USER in cloud jupyter notebook for running transformer models
body:
I am using `mlflow version 1.22.0.` 
How can I pass namespace to mlflow experiment in PAZ notebook such that I can see experiment from ai platform.
Currently I am using this: 

```
import os
import mlflow
os.environ['GIT_PYTHON_REFRESH']='quiet'
mlflow.set_tracking_uri(os.environ['MLFLOW_TRACKING_URL'])
print(os.environ['MLFLOW_TRACKING_URL'])
experiment_id = mlflow.create_experiment("Experiment")
experiment = mlflow.get_experiment(experiment_id)
print("Name: {}".format(experiment.name))
print("Experiment_id: {}".format(experiment.experiment_id))
print("Artifact Location: {}".format(experiment.artifact_location))
print("Tags: {}".format(experiment.tags))
print("Lifecycle_stage: {}".format(experiment.lifecycle_stage))
mlflow.set_experiment('Experiment')
```

But I want to tag it to to user namespace something like: 

`mlflow.set_experiment('Experiment',os.environ['USER'])`

`Error: MlflowException: Must specify exactly one of: `experiment_id` or `experiment_name`.`

**I want to use same version of mlflow. Is there another way to tag USER?**

Also in MLFLOW UI, I see blank `Run Name`, `Version`, `Models`. How to se these values for different runs?

I want to do something like `mlflow.run_name('RUN1')`, `mlflow.Models('Model1')`

I am not using `mlflow.start(...)` as hugging face automatically  tracks it.
